page-subtitle: Sharing Non-Peer-Reviewed Things I've Made for the Greater Good :)

publications.title: The Learning Theory Map
publications.description: A primer and quick-reference to learn about learning theories, created for my undergraduate “Learning Theories for Teachers” course as a ‘first exposure’ to learning theory.

publications.title: A Critical Theories Crash Course for Learning Scientists-in-Training
publications.description: An in-depth resource introducing critical theories to learning scientists, featuring curated reading lists, teaching strategies, and guidance on integrating equity-focused frameworks into education research and practice.

publications.title: Academic Website Template
publications.description: A GitHub Pages template for academics who need a free, easy-to-edit, low-tech website. morganavickery.com uses this template!

publications.title: Morgan's Template for Outlining Academic Arguments
publications.description: A scaffold I created & shared while working as a Graduate Tutor at IU's Writing Tutorial Services—particularly useful for supporting undergraduate students learning how to write an academic/course paper.

publications.title: Medical Specialty Camp Literature Database
publications.description: An interactive database of literature from a systematic review of research conducted at camps specifically for youth/adults with disabilities, chronic illness, and medical needs. A passion project by myself (developer/designer) and my partner Dr. Jonathan Gerth (reviewer).

publications.title: LearnabilityHQ.com
publications.description: Learnability is a knowledge base for educators and learners of all ages. We gather free, high-quality educational resources from around the internet and make them easily accessible for the everyday educator. Passion project by myself (Technical Lead & Designer) and Dr. Megan Humburg (Content Lead).

publications.title: Sample Lesson Plans for Critique & Redesign
publications.description: A collection of 'messy' and minimalistic (often AI-generated) lesson plans curated for use by my undergraduate students while learning how to critique, iterate on, and theoretically ground lesson plan designs.

publications.title: Publicly Available Classroom Video Index
publications.description: An index of publicly available, open-access instructional and classroom observation videos for in-class demos and video/interaction analysis practice. Intended for use with undergraduate pre-service teachers and junior graduate students of learning theories.

publications.title: Resources for Being Human in Bloomington
publications.description: A curation of local resources and organizations at IU / in Bloomington for students who need support 'being human' (i.e., food/housing insecurity, LGBTQ+ resources, violence, funding, counseling, etc.).

publications.title: Things I Wish I Knew About the Learning Sciences
publications.description: A practical, researcher-informed guide to key theories, frameworks, and figures in the learning sciences—ideal for newcomers seeking foundational concepts, major citations, and methodological overviews in education research.
